SuSuSuSUPERNOVA!! Nova is a **simple, fast, and elegant task management chatbot** that helps you keep track of your todos, deadlines, and events. Interact with Nova through a clean GUI or CLI interface to manage your tasks efficiently.
- **Reliable**: Automatic saving to ensure your tasks are never lost
1. Download the latest `nova.jar` from the releases page
2. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as Novaâ€™s home folder.
3. Open a terminal, `cd` into that folder and run
4. Type commands in the text box and press Enter or click Send
5. Your tasks are automatically saved to `data/nova.txt`
Shows all tasks in your task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Adds a simple task without any date or time.
> **Note:** Make sure there is at least one space between `todo` and `DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` must not be empty.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
> **Note:** Nova prevents duplicate tasks - you can't add the same task twice!
- For `ToDo` tasks, a duplicate means having the same **description**.
- For `Deadline` tasks, a duplicate means having the same **description** and **due date**.
- For `Event` tasks, a duplicate means having the same **description**, **start time**, and **end time**.
Adds a task with a deadline.
> **Note:** Make sure there is at least one space before /by and after /by. The /by keyword must be present, and both the description and date/time must not be empty.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a task that happens over a period of time.

> **Note:** Make sure there is at least one space before /from and /to, and at least one space after each keyword. Both /from and /to must be present, and the description, start time, and end time must not be empty.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
> **Note:** Make sure there is at least one space between `mark` and `INDEX`, `INDEX` must not be empty.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
> **Note:** The index refers to the task number shown in the `list` command.
### Marking a task as not done: `unmark`
> **Note:** Make sure there is at least one space between `unmark` and `INDEX`, `INDEX` must not be empty.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Searches for tasks containing the specified keyword. **Case-insensitive!**
> **Note:** Make sure there is at least one space between `find` and `KEYWORD`, `KEYWORD` must not be empty.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
> **Note:** Searching for "BOOK", "book", or "Book" will all return the same results!
Removes a task from your list permanently.
> **Note:** Make sure there is at least one space between `delete` and `INDEX`, `INDEX` must not be empty.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
private Command(CommandType type, Integer index, String desc, String by, String from, String to) {
assert type != null : "CommandType must not be null";
if (type == CommandType.MARK || type == CommandType.UNMARK || type == CommandType.DELETE) {
assert index != null : "Index required for " + type;
assert desc != null : "Description/keyword required for " + type;
assert desc != null && by != null : "Deadline requires desc and by";
assert desc != null && from != null && to != null : "Event requires desc/from/to";
return new Command(CommandType.EXIT, null, null, null, null, null);
return new Command(CommandType.LIST, null, null, null, null, null);

* The main entry point for the nova.Nova application.
* It works with {@link Ui}, {@link Parser}, {@link TaskList},
* and {@link Storage}, loads existing tasks on startup and runs a command loop
* Initializes the user interface and storage components, and attempts
* to load existing tasks from the specified file path. If loading fails
* due to an I/O error, an error message is displayed and the application
* starts with an empty task list.
* @param filePath The file path used for loading and saving tasks.
* Runs the main command loop of the application.
* Displays a welcome message, then repeatedly reads user input,
* parses it into a {@link Command}, and executes it until an exit
* Any {@link NovaException} thrown during parsing or execution is
* caught and shown to the user as an error message. Any {@link IOException}
* related to loading or saving tasks is also caught and reported.
